duties_responsibilities.duty: Collaborate with senior leadership to identify opportunities and technology solutions, develop business cases, and gain alignment for technology investment and project decisions.
Lead the Retail Execution and Category Management technology strategy, roadmap, and execution.
Manage overall IT demand, continuously manage business partner expectations, and prepare/deliver regular updates and communications to the Business and IT Sr. Leadership teams.
Conduct research on current/future technologies, processes, and best practices, and determine the application of new technologies.
Lead projects of medium and large complexity, act as liaison between various IT organizations, and champion the change management efforts of IT initiatives.
Interface with suppliers and vendors to evaluate software, hardware, or services and make recommendations.
Ensure Service Level Agreements are established and meet expectations of the business partners.
Champion the change management efforts of IT initiatives with the business partner community.
Participate in the business planning activities by identifying future business demand and gaining alignment for appropriate funding.
Provide coaching/guidance to peers, junior team members, co-ops, and/or consultants.
Ensure Kenvue information assets are appropriately identified, valued, and protected by complying with and enforcing all local and worldwide security policies.
Consider and emphasize security in all Kenvue plans and actions.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred)
